conversation.content: Напиши развёрнутую статью на 1000 слов по теме: предупреждение и профилактика онкологии

Онкологические заболевания - одна из наиболее серьезных проблем, с которыми сталкивается современное здравоохранение. Каждый год миллионы людей по всему миру становятся жертвами рака. Тем не менее, многие случаи онкологии можно предотвратить. В этой статье мы рассмотрим основные причины рака и приведем ряд рекомендаций, которые помогут сохранить ваше здоровье и предотвратить развитие онкологических заболеваний.

Почему возникает онкология?

Процесс развития онкологии - это довольно сложный и многогранный процесс, который зависит от многих факторов. В большинстве случаев онкология развивается на фоне комбинации генетических, окружающих и стилевых факторов.

Генетические факторы. Некоторые люди, в зависимости от наследственности, через несколько лет могут развить онкологическое заболевание, в то время как другие не будут сталкиваться с этой проблемой на протяжении всей жизни.

Окружающая среда. Ассоциация рака с окружающей средой, включая загрязнение воздуха, воды и почвы, ресурсы и инфраструктуру, будет описана в деталях ниже.

Образ жизни. Диета, уровень активности, использование сигарет, алкоголь и другие вещества, влияют на вероятность развития онкологических заболеваний.

Основные советы по профилактике онкологии:

1. Следите за своим здоровьем. Каждый должен знать свое тело, просматривать его наличие отклонений (узелков, бугристостей, пятен, рубцов). При любых изменениях объемов тканей или кожи, необходимо обратиться к врачу.

2. СТОП ТЛЕН. Одним из наиболее эффективных способов предотвращения рака является отказ от использования табака и минимизация количество алкоголя.

3. Следите за вашей диетой. Продукты, которые вы употребляете, могут влиять на вероятность развития рака. Старайтесь употреблять меньше жареного, сладкого и жирного. В значительной степени должна превалировать низко калорийная, содержащая больше овощей и плодов, диета.

4. Увеличьте количество физической активности. Регулярное занятие физическими упражнениями помогает контролировать свой вес и повышает уровень энергии. Более высокий уровень физической активности также связан с уменьшением риска развития многих видов рака.

5. Старайтесь снизить уровень стресса. Стресс - это не только плохо для вашего психического здоровья, но и может иметь влияние на уровень гормонов, которые могут повлиять на вероятность развития рака. Найдите способы расслабиться и снять стресс, это способствует улучшению вашего здоровья в целом.

6. Принимайте сбалансированные дозы витаминов и минералов. Витамины - это важная составляющая здоровой диеты, поскольку они помогают вашему организму функционировать должным образом. Для предотвращения рака нужно употреблять сбалансированные комплексы витаминов и минералов, или их источники в питании.

7. Осуществляйте профилактическую медицинскую помощь. Исключить явлении рака невозможно, но поддерживать свой организм здоровым и защищенным можно. Регулярные медицинские осмотры помогут выявить любые изменения до того, как они повлекут за собой более серьезные последствия.

Выводы

Онкология - это серьезная проблема, которая может возникнуть у любого человека в любом возрасте. Тем не менее, соблюдение правильного образа жизни и регулярное следование семи приведенным выше рекомендациям могут помочь снизить риск развития онкологических заболеваний. Не откладывайте заботу о своем здоровье на потом! Старайтесь сделать шаги, которые помогут вам сохранить свое здоровье, и убедитесь, что вы регулярно получаете профилактическую медицинскую помощь.
Продолжи статью

Как именно оказывается влияние на вероятность развития онкологических заболеваний?

По сути, онкология преимущественно является результатом вредных физических, химических и биологических воздействий на клетки нашего организма. Эти воздействия могут нарушать нормальную работу клеток, приводить к их смерти или вызывать мутации в генах, контролирующих деление клеток.

Вредные факторы могут быть как внешними, так и внутренними. Общепризнаными воздействиями, которые могут привести к онкологии, являются:

1. Воздействие табака. Он - главный причинитель рака легких и других типов рака. При контакте с легкими, табачный дым разрушает и вызывает мутации в генах легких, что приводит к развитию онкологии. Кроме того, табак может вызывать рак на других органах, таких как горло, язык, желудок, печень и мочевой пузырь.

2. Употребление алкоголя. Употребление алкоголя влияет на вероятность заболевания раком головного мозга, рта, горла, пищевода, грудной клетки и печени. Употребление алкоголя также может быть связано со снижением иммунитета, что может способствовать нарушению работы клеток, что может привести к онкологии.

3. Пищевые привычки. Слишком большое употребление жирной пищи, такой как мясо, может способствовать повышению уровня холестерина в крови, что может вызвать развитие болезней, в том числе рака. Также, малое количество фруктов и овощей может способствовать ухудшению состояния клеток и повышаться риск заболевания онкологией.

4. Загрязнение окружающей среды. Загрязненный воздух и вода, а также вредное поведение человека (химические вещества, выбросы вредных промышленных отходов и т.д.) могут иметь явное влияние на здоровье людей.

5. Физическое и психологическое напряжение. Существует доказательство того, что длительный период депрессии, а также физический и психологический стресс могут привести к возникновению онкологических заболеваний.

Как лучше всего защититься от онкологии?

Как мы уже установили, есть много факторов, которые могут влиять на вероятность развития онкологических заболеваний. Однако, в жизни каждого человека есть ряд простых и эффективных мер, которые можно принимать, чтобы защитить свое здоровье и уменьшить вероятность развития онкологии. Вот несколько основных рекомендаций.

1. Уменьшайте употребление табака. Существует множество программ по бросанию курения, включая методы на основе никотиновой замены, когнитивно-поведенческие методы общения с врачом или другими специалистами. Ну, и конечно, просто надо начать!

2. Увеличьте количество физической активности. Регулярные занятия спортом и упражнениями могут помочь контролировать вес, укреплять мышцы и укреплять иммунную систему, что может уменьшить вероятность развития онкологических заболеваний.

3. Ешьте здоровую диету. Питайтесь большим количеством овощей, фруктов и злаков. Уменьшите количество жирной пищи и обработанных продуктов. Избегайте употребления излишнего количества алкоголя и табака.

4. Регулярно проходите медицинские обследования. Регулярные медицинские обследования могут помочь выявить любые изменения в вашем здоровье, которые могут привести к онкологической болезни, и предотвратить их развитие на ранней стадии.

5. Следите за своим уровнем стресса. Найдите способы расслабиться и снять стресс, такие как йога, медитация, глубокое дыхание и другие способы. Это может помочь улучшить качество вашей жизни и уменьшить вероятность развития онкологии.

Заключение

Безусловно, рак - это одно из самых страшных заболеваний, с которым мы сталкиваемся в нашей жизни. Однако, как мы видим, существует целый ряд мер, которые можно принимать, чтобы предотвратить развитие онкологических заболеваний. Старайтесь следовать этим рекомендациям и следить за своим здоровьем, и вы можете обезопасить свою жизнь от этой серьезной болезни!

In vivo imaging demonstrated that the knockdown of lnc070974 dramatically impeded the growth rate of xenografts (Fig. 4F). Simultaneously, the number of tumor nodules was significantly reduced in lnc070974-depleted A549 cell-injected nude mice when compared to sh-NC group mice (Fig. 4G, white arrows indicate). Furthermore, in agreement with tumor suppression, HE staining revealed that the knockdown of lnc070974 markedly decreased the number and size of tumor nodules (Fig. 4H, black arrows indicate). Altogether, these results strongly suggest that lnc070974 silencing inhibits lung tumor growth and metastasis both in vitro and in vivo.

conversation.content: напиши статью 1000 слов: лечение пневмонии Бадами

Пневмония является серьезным заболеванием легких, которое может привести к осложнениям и даже смерти. Учитывая это, крайне важно обратиться за медицинской помощью вовремя и начать лечение. Кроме традиционных методов лечения, таких как лекарства и антибиотики, существуют также альтернативные методы, одним из которых являются бады. В этой статье мы рассмотрим, как бады могут помочь в лечении пневмонии и как их использовать.

Что такое бады?

Бады - это биологически активные добавки, которые используются в качестве дополнения к питанию. Они могут содержать различные витамины, минералы, растительные экстракты и другие питательные вещества. Бады могут быть полезны для здоровья в целом, а также использоваться для лечения различных заболеваний.

Как бады могут помочь в лечении пневмонии?

Бады могут помочь в лечении пневмонии, так как они могут укреплять иммунную систему организма, повышать его защитные свойства и улучшать самочувствие. Кроме того, некоторые бады содержат вещества, которые могут помочь при лечении конкретных симптомов пневмонии, таких как кашель и одышка.

Какие виды бадов можно использовать для лечения пневмонии?

1. Эхинацея. Эхинацея - это растение, которое часто используется в качестве дополнения к питанию. Она содержит вещества, которые могут помочь укрепить иммунную систему и облегчить симптомы пневмонии, такие как кашель и осина.

2. Чеснок. Чеснок - это растение, которое известно своими антибактериальными свойствами. Он может помочь в борьбе с инфекциями, которые могут привести к пневмонии.

3. Шиповник. Шиповник - это плод шиповника, который содержит большое количество витамина С. Витамин С может помочь улучшить работу иммунной системы организма и снизить риск развития пневмонии.

4. Грецкий орех. Грецкий орех - это орех, который содержит большое количество витаминов и минералов, а также антиоксидантов. Он может помочь укрепить иммунную систему и повысить её защитные свойства.

Как использовать бады для лечения пневмонии?

Если вы хотите использовать бады для лечения пневмонии, обязательно сначала обратитесь за советом к своему врачу. Он сможет оценить ваше состояние и посоветовать наиболее подходящий вариант бада для вас. Кроме того, следуйте указаниям на упаковке и не превышайте рекомендованную дозу. Не забывайте также о необходимости продолжать принимать лекарства, которые назначил вам врач.

В заключении

Пневмония - это серьезное заболевание, которое
продолжить статью

требует быстрого и правильного лечения. Кроме традиционных методов лечения, таких как лекарства и антибиотики, альтернативные методы, такие как бады, могут быть полезны в укреплении иммунной системы организма и улучшении самочувствия. Однако, перед использованием бадов необходимо сначала проконсультироваться с врачом и следовать указаниям на упаковке. 

Кроме использования бадов, важно также соблюдать правильный режим питания, употреблять достаточно жидкости и обеспечить организм с отдыхом и сном. Также следует избегать вредных привычек, таких как курение и употребление алкоголя, которые могут ухудшить состояние здоровья и увеличить риск развития пневмонии.

Наконец, важно помнить, что лучший способ бороться с пневмонией - это ее профилактика. Избегайте контакта с больными, соблюдайте гигиену рук и дыхательных путей, обращайтесь за медицинской помощью вовремя при появлении симптомов заболевания.

В целом, лечение пневмонии Бадами может быть эффективным методом совместно с традиционными методами лечения. Однако, не забывайте, что самое важное - это своевременное обращение к врачу и соблюдение его рекомендаций.

The idea behind snapshot object identification is to first identify core pixels, sort them, and then perform clustering starting from the highest-ranked core pixels, successively expanding the clusters until all pixels are assigned. The method steps can be summarized as follows:

1) Scan all pixels and collect core pixels into a list L.
2) Sort core pixels in list L in descending order based on the difference between pixel attribute values and global attribute averages.
3) Select an unclustered core pixel from the sorted list L, add it to a core pixel queue Q, and initiate a new cluster search using this core pixel.
4) Remove a core pixel from queue Q and expand its cluster by incorporating reachable, non-isolated, and unclustered pixels in its spatial neighborhood. If the newly added pixel is also a core pixel, add it to queue Q.
5) If queue Q is not empty, return to step 4. Otherwise, proceed to step 3 until all core pixels in list L have been traversed.

In step 2, the goal of sorting is to initiate clustering from core pixels with a larger attribute distance from the precipitation anomaly background in subsequent steps. The average value of all pixels in the time series serves as an approximation of the background. In step 4, a pixel within the spatial neighborhood of the core pixel is assessed to determine if it can be added to the cluster of the core pixel. This judgment relies on three criteria: (1) whether it has not been clustered; (2) whether it is reachable from the core pixel's cluster; (3) whether it is not an isolated pixel.

A pixel is considered reachable for a cluster when the difference between the pixel's attribute value and the average attribute value of the cluster does not exceed AttEps. Isolated pixels are reachable pixels situated at the corners of the spatial neighborhood that are not connected to other reachable pixels. The rationale for excluding isolated pixels from clusters is to prevent erroneously assigning noise to the cluster edges and to avoid merging two clusters without spatial connectivity into a single cluster. The patch object extraction pseudocode is as follows:

---

| depent on | depends on | Correcting grammar |
| whether it have not been clustered | whether it has not been clustered | Correct grammar (subject-verb agreement) |
| whether it is reachable from the cluster of the core pixel | whether it is reachable from the core pixel's cluster | Increase clarity and improve phrasing |
| while connected pixels is not reachable | while connected pixels are not reachable | Correct grammar (subject-verb agreement) |

Perform clustering with different combinations of MinPixs and AttEps parameters and calculate the average variance across all clusters in the clustering results. To prevent potentially smaller average variance while avoiding missed clusters, this study also incorporates the background of ocean anomaly changes as a classification aspect for statistical purposes. For instance, assume that the calculation result for parameter combination A is reasonable, while the result for combination B is unreasonable and lacks a cluster. In this case, the average variance of B may be equal to or even smaller than that of A. Thus, to present a more objective and comprehensive representation of the clustering results, this study calculates the cluster average variance by considering the background at all times as a cluster component. Below is a paragraph from an Chinese academic paper. Translate it step by step. "假设每个时刻有且仅有一幅栅格数据作为方法输入，定义t为时间序列长度，n为每幅栅格数据的像元个数。OSCAR方法主要包含2个阶段，第1个阶段是快照对象的提取，第2个阶段是快照对象的时空聚类。
（1）快照对象提取
快照对象的提取首先需要收集一张栅格图像数据中的所有核心像元，需要遍历所有栅格像元并逐个检查是否为核心像元，时间复杂度为O(n)。收集所有核心像元之后，采用快速排序方法对核心像元进行排序，平均时间复杂度是O(n log n)。遍历排序后的核心像元列表，从距离数据集平均值最大的核心像元开始搜索相似像元并进行聚类。因为聚类过程中不会对已经聚类的像元重复聚类，也不会将已聚类像元重新加入搜索队列，所以聚类过程的时间复杂度为O(n)。综上所述，快照对象提取过程的时间复杂度是O(n log n)。
（2）快照对象时空聚类
快照对象的时空聚类需要按照栅格的时间顺序遍历t张栅格图像数据。对于每个时刻的栅格图像数据，首先进行时间复杂度为O(n log n)的快照对象提取，然后在前一时刻的快照列表中搜索与当前时刻快照存在空间相交的快照对象。假设m为某一时刻状态的快照数量，则在搜索相交的快照时需要对mt个快照进行遍历，对于每个快照还需要在前一时刻的mt-1个快照中查找与其存在空间相交的快照对象，一共需要作mt mt-1次比较。
虽然快照对象的数量远小于栅格像元的数量，但是尺寸更大的栅格图像很可能包含更多的快照对象，故假设快照对象的数量m与一幅栅格数据的像元数量n成正比。因此，搜索相交快照的时间复杂度为O(n2)。综上所述，快照对象时空聚类的时间复杂度为O(t n2)，与时间序列长度成正比，还与单个时刻栅格数据量的2次方也成正比，这也是整个海洋异常变化时空聚类方法的时间复杂度。
"

Assuming that there is only one grid data input at each moment, let t be the length of the time series and n be the number of pixels in each grid data. The OSCAR method mainly includes two stages: the first stage is the extraction of snapshot objects, and the second stage is the spatiotemporal clustering of snapshot objects.

(1) Snapshot object extraction
The extraction of snapshot objects first requires collecting all core pixels in a grid image data, by traversing all grid pixels and checking whether they are core pixels one by one, with a time complexity of O(n). After collecting all core pixels, the quicksort method is used to sort them, with an average time complexity of O(n log n). Traverse the sorted list of core pixels, start searching for similar pixels from the core pixels with the largest distance from the dataset mean, and perform clustering. Since the clustering process does not re-cluster pixels that have been clustered, nor does it re-add clustered pixels to the search queue, the time complexity of the clustering process is O(n). In summary, the time complexity of the snapshot object extraction process is O(n log n).

(2) Spatiotemporal clustering of snapshot objects
Spatiotemporal clustering of snapshot objects requires traversing t grid image datasets in the order of grid time. For each moment's grid image data, the snapshot object extraction with a time complexity of O(n log n) is first performed, and then the snapshot object from the previous moment's snapshot list intersecting the current moment's snapshot in space is searched. Suppose m is the number of snapshots at a certain moment, then mt snapshots need to be traversed in searching for intersecting snapshots, and for each snapshot, the space-intersecting snapshot objects need to be found among the previous mt-1 snapshots, thus requiring mt * mt-1 comparisons in total.

Although the number of snapshot objects is much smaller than the number of grid pixels, larger grid images may contain more snapshot objects. Therefore, it is assumed that the number of snapshot objects m is directly proportional to the number of pixels n in a grid data. Thus, the time complexity of searching for intersecting snapshots is O(n^2). In summary, the time complexity of spatiotemporal clustering of snapshot objects is O(t n^2), which is proportional to the length of the time series and also proportional to the square of the amount of single-moment grid data. This is also the time complexity of the entire spatiotemporal clustering method for ocean anomaly changes.

The spatio-temporal clustering evolution process of the OSCAR method is shown in Figures 3 and 4, which include the clustering results corresponding to different values of parameter θ. Upon comparison, it can be found that different values of θ can accurately identify the development and disappearance evolution process A, as well as the evolution process C with merging and splitting events. However, for the moving evolution process B, the results of different θ values vary significantly. When θ is 0.25, the evolution process states can be effectively identified at each time point. When θ is 0.75, the moving evolution process B is only recognized during the relatively slow movement times of 5 to 7, resulting in poorer clustering effects compared to when θ is 0.5.

In summary, the larger the value of θ, the higher the required proportion of patch overlapping areas within the patch objects for spatio-temporal clustering. For fast-moving evolution processes, the faster the movement speed, the smaller the overlapping area of patches at adjacent times. Comparisons reveal that various θ values accurately identify the evolution processes of development and disappearance (A) and merging and splitting events (C). Nevertheless, for the moving evolution process (B), results differ substantially based on θ values. When θ is 0.25, each timepoint's evolution process states can be effectively recognized. Conversely, with θ set at 0.5, the moving evolution process (B) is insufficiently identified, resulting in discontinuous output spatio-temporal clusters. At times 3 and 7, the evolution process (B) is divided into three spatio-temporal clusters—specifically, clusters 4, 6, and 7. The movement speed of evolution process (B) around times 3 and 7 fosters lower overlapping degrees of patches at subsequent times, causing interrupted expansions of spatio-temporal clusters in the temporal dimension and the emergence of new spatio-temporal clusters. With θ at 0.75, the moving evolution process (B) is only detected when movement is comparatively slow (during times 5 to 7), yielding a weaker clustering effect than with θ at 0.5.

Overall, as θ increases, spatio-temporal clustering necessitates a higher proportion of overlap within patch objects. For rapidly moving evolution processes, an increase in speed coincides with a decrease in the overlapping area of patches at adjacent times. Thus, fast-moving evolution processes require lower θ values, with movement speed dictating the appropriateness of smaller θ parameters.

"DcSTCA方法在对聚簇进行扩展时，核心像元需要递归调用ExpandCluster函数。在最坏情况下，ExpandCluster会被递归调用n ∗ (2 ∗ ΔT + 1) ∗ (ε + 1)，其中n为数据集中核心像元数量，ΔT为时间阈值参数，ε为空间邻域数量（Liu，2018）。假设栅格数据集的时间序列长度是10，栅格尺寸是100×100，那么在最坏情况下，递归调用的深度达到100000数量级。即使不是处于最坏情况之下，只要数据集中的海洋异常变化过程足够稀疏，也很容易在对背景像元进行聚类时发生栈溢出（Stack Overflow）异常。为了保证DcSTCA方法的实验能够正常进行，本文对输入DcSTCA方法的数据进行特殊的预处理，对背景像元进行过滤和掩膜。预处理的方法是先统计栅格数据集的属性平均值和标准差，然后将属性值与平均值之差小于标准差的像元赋值0。
DcSTCA方法的最终聚类结果如图5所示，图中的栅格图像是对背景像元掩膜后的结果。对于发展和消亡的演化过程A及存在合并和分裂事件的演化过程C，DcSTCA方法基本能够识别演化过程在各个时刻的状态。对于演化过程C，不少时刻的聚簇中都存在不合理的空洞，特别是时刻5至时刻9期间。演化过程A在时刻4、5和7的部分边缘像元被遗漏，这些像元的共同特点是没有在前后时刻出现异常，也就是出现异常的持续时间不超过3个时刻。DcSTCA方法对移动中的演化过程B的聚类结果明显更差，只能识别在前后时刻均出现异常的像元，也就是3个连续时刻中海洋异常快照相交的区域。
DcSTCA方法未能有效识别移动过程B和A的原因是，DcSTCA方法对核心像元的定义是不仅时空密度大于密度阈值，而且在前后T时刻的属性与当前时刻属性的距离小于属性距离阈值。这导致DcSTCA方法无法识别前后时刻空间变化较大的演变过程
"

When expanding clusters using the DcSTCA method, the core pixels need to recursively call the ExpandCluster function. In the worst case, ExpandCluster will be recursively called n * (2 * ΔT + 1) * (ε + 1) times, where n is the number of core pixels in the dataset, ΔT is the time threshold parameter, and ε is the number of spatial neighborhoods (Liu, 2018). Assuming the time series length of the grid dataset is 10 and the grid size is 100×100, the depth of the recursive call can reach up to 100,000 in the worst case. Even if not in the worst-case scenario, as long as the ocean anomaly changes in the dataset are sparse enough, a stack overflow exception may occur during the clustering of background pixels. In order to ensure the normal progress of the DcSTCA method experiment, this paper pre-processes the input data for the DcSTCA method by filtering and masking background pixels. The pre-processing method is to first calculate the mean and standard deviation of the grid dataset attributes, and then assign a value of 0 to pixels whose attribute value difference from the mean is less than the standard deviation.

The final clustering result of the DcSTCA method is shown in Figure 5, in which the grid image is the result after masking the background pixels. The DcSTCA method can basically identify the states of the evolving processes A, which involves development and dissipation, and C, which involves merging and splitting events, at various moments. For evolving process C, there are unreasonable gaps in many clusters, especially between moments 5 and 9. In the evolving process A, some edge pixels are missing at moments 4, 5, and 7, and their common feature is that they do not show anomalies at the previous and following moments, meaning the anomaly duration does not exceed three moments. The DcSTCA method's clustering results for the moving evolving process B are significantly worse, as it can only identify pixels with anomalies that appear in both the previous and following moments, that is, the intersection areas of ocean anomaly snapshots across three consecutive moments.

The reason that the DcSTCA method was unable to effectively identify moving processes B and A is that the definition of core pixels in the DcSTCA method not only requires the spatiotemporal density greater than the density threshold but also needs the attribute distances between the previous and next T moments and the current moment to be less than the attribute distance threshold. This leads to the DcSTCA method being unable to recognize evolving processes with significant spatial changes between previous and following moments.

DcSTCA方法的最终聚类结果如图5所示，图中的栅格图像是对背景像元掩膜后的结果。对于发展和消亡的演化过程A及存在合并和分裂事件的演化过程C，DcSTCA方法基本能够识别演化过程在各个时刻的状态。对于演化过程C，不少时刻的聚簇中都存在不合理的空洞，特别是时刻5至时刻9期间。演化过程A在时刻4、5和7的部分边缘像元被遗漏，这些像元的共同特点是没有在前后时刻出现异常，也就是出现异常的持续时间不超过3个时刻。DcSTCA方法对移动中的演化过程B的聚类结果明显更差，只能识别在前后时刻均出现异常的像元，也就是3个连续时刻中海洋异常快照相交的区域。
DcSTCA方法未能有效识别移动过程B和A的原因是，DcSTCA方法对核心像元的定义是不仅时空密度大于密度阈值，而且在前后T时刻的属性与当前时刻属性的距离小于属性距离阈值。这导致DcSTCA方法无法识别前后时刻空间变化较大的演变过程

In the DcSTCA method, when expanding clusters, core pixels need to recursively call the ExpandCluster function. In the worst case, ExpandCluster will be recursively called n * (2 * ΔT + 1) * (ε + 1) times, where n is the number of core pixels in the dataset, ΔT is the time threshold parameter, and ε is the number of spatial neighborhoods (Liu, 2018). Assuming the time series length of the grid dataset is 10 and the grid size is 100×100, in the worst case, the depth of recursive calls reaches the magnitude of 100000. Even if not in the worst case, as long as the ocean anomaly changes in the dataset are sparse enough, a Stack Overflow exception is likely to occur when clustering background pixels. To ensure that the DcSTCA method experiment can proceed normally, this paper preprocesses the data input to the DcSTCA method by filtering and masking the background pixels. The preprocessing method is to first calculate the mean and standard deviation of the grid dataset attributes, and then assign 0 to pixels with attribute value differences from the mean smaller than the standard deviation.

The final clustering results of the DcSTCA method are shown in Figure 5, with the grid image being the result after masking the background pixels. For the development and extinction evolution process A and the evolution process C that involves merging and splitting events, the DcSTCA method can basically recognize the state of the evolution process at each time. For evolution process C, there are many unreasonable gaps in the clusters at many time points, especially between moment 5 and moment 9. For evolution process A, some edge pixels are missing at moments 4, 5, and 7, the common feature of these pixels is that they do not show anomalies in previous and following moments, that is, the duration of the anomaly does not exceed 3 moments. The clustering results of the DcSTCA method for the moving evolution process B are obviously worse, and it can only recognize pixels with anomalies at both previous and following moments, that is, the intersection area of ocean anomaly snapshots in 3 consecutive moments.

The reason that the DcSTCA method failed to effectively identify moving processes B and A is that the definition of core pixels in the DcSTCA method is not only that the spatiotemporal density is greater than the density threshold but also that the distance between the attributes of the previous and following T moments and the current moment's attributes is less than the attribute distance threshold. This leads to the DcSTCA method's inability to identify evolution processes with significant spatial changes in previous and following moments.

"本文将采用双月多元ENSO指数（Multivariate ENSO Index，MEI）作为ENSO事件强弱的指标，对海表降水异常变化与ENSO的关系进行分析。MEI指数由海平面气压、海面温度、地表风的纬向和经向分量以及出射长波辐射5个指标计算得到（Wolter & Timlin，1993）。考虑到 ENSO的季节性及屏蔽季节内变化的影响，MEI指数对12个重叠的双月“季节”进行计算，例如12月至1月、1月至2月等等。McPhaden等（2006）曾根据MEI指数对ENSO事件进行定义：厄尔尼诺事件（El Niño）是指MEI指数至少持续5个月不小于0.5的时期，而拉尼娜事件（La Niña）是指MEI指数至少持续5个月不大于-0.5的时期。
GPM综合多卫星检索（The Integrated Multi-satellite Retrievals for GPM，IMERG）是Global Precipitation Measurement项目下的数据融合方法，在全球范围内对所有微波卫星降水数据、红外卫星降水数据以及其他降水数据进行相互校准、融合和插值。其中IMERG-Final Run是精度最高的科研数据系列，其时间覆盖范围是2000年6月至2021年9月。
获取IMERG-Final Run数据之后，将其重采样至1°×1°再计算降水异常变化。因为降水的月周期波动掩盖了ENSO事件引起的年周期波动，所以本文以月为单位利用Z-Score方法进行标准化距平，所得结果即为降水异常，计算公式如式2所示。
"

1) Translation:

This paper uses the bimonthly Multivariate ENSO Index (MEI) as an indicator of the strength of ENSO events to analyze the relationship between sea surface precipitation anomalies and ENSO. The MEI index is calculated from five indicators, including sea level pressure, sea surface temperature, zonal and meridional components of surface wind, and outgoing longwave radiation (Wolter & Timlin, 1993). Considering ENSO's seasonality and shielding the influence of intraseasonal variations, the MEI index is calculated for 12 overlapping bimonthly "seasons," such as December to January, January to February, etc. McPhaden et al. (2006) defined ENSO events based on the MEI index: El Niño events refer to periods when the MEI index is at least 0.5 for five consecutive months, while La Niña events refer to periods when the MEI index is no greater than -0.5 for at least five consecutive months.

The Integrated Multi-satellite Retrievals for GPM (IMERG) is a data fusion method under the Global Precipitation Measurement project, which calibrates, merges, and interpolates all microwave satellite precipitation data, infrared satellite precipitation data, and other precipitation data on a global scale. Among them, the IMERG-Final Run is the most accurate research data series, covering the period from June 2000 to September 2021.

After obtaining the IMERG-Final Run data, it is resampled to 1°×1° and used to calculate precipitation anomalies. Because the monthly fluctuations of precipitation mask the annual fluctuations caused by ENSO events, this paper employs the Z-Score method to standardize anomalies on a monthly basis. The resulting precipitation anomalies are calculated using the formula shown in Equation 2.

2) Rephrasing:

This study employs the bimonthly Multivariate ENSO Index (MEI) to serve as a marker for ENSO event intensity, which will then be used to examine the connection between sea surface precipitation anomalies and ENSO. The MEI index is derived from five parameters: sea-level pressure, sea surface temperature, zonal and meridional components of surface winds, and outgoing longwave radiation (Wolter & Timlin, 1993). Given the seasonality of ENSO and the need to account for intraseasonal variations, the MEI index is computed for 12 overlapping bimonthly "seasons," such as December to January and January to February. According to McPhaden et al. (2006), El Niño events are characterized by an MEI index of at least 0.5 for five consecutive months, while La Niña events occur when the MEI index is no more than -0.5 for a minimum of five consecutive months.

The Integrated Multi-satellite Retrievals for GPM (IMERG) is a data integration method utilized by the Global Precipitation Measurement project. It involves the calibration, merging, and interpolation of microwave satellite precipitation data, infrared satellite precipitation data, and other precipitation data on a global scale. The IMERG-Final Run, in particular, is the most precise data series for research purposes, spanning from June 2000 to September 2021.

Upon acquiring the IMERG-Final Run data, it is resampled to a 1°×1° grid to calculate precipitation anomalies. As the monthly oscillations of precipitation obscure the annual oscillations induced by ENSO events, this study employs the Z-Score method for normalizing anomalies on a monthly basis. The derived precipitation anomalies are computed using the formula presented in Equation 2.

"本文将OSCAR方法应用于2015年至2016年之间海表降水异常变化的时空聚类，方法参数θ取0.5、K取7及Kth取1.41。图4 2是厄尔尼诺事件期间的时空聚类结果图，图中深蓝色轮廓多边形代表热带太平洋典型时空聚簇，淡灰色轮廓多边形代表其他时空聚簇。
在2015年5月，1个降水正异常强度显著大于周边区域的时空聚簇首次出现在热带太平洋东部，整体呈长条状，西至热带太平洋中部。在2015年5月至2015年10月之间，时空聚簇不断缓慢向西扩展。2015年11月至2016年1月，时空聚簇不再向西扩展，而是在热带太平洋中部呈现向南扩展的趋势，与此同时，热带太平洋东部的降水正异常开始减弱，到了2016年2月已经基本恢复正常水平。从2016年2月开始，时空聚簇的面积开始快速缩小，聚簇内的SSPA值也显著降低。最终时空聚簇在2016年4月结束于热带太平洋中部。总而言之，时空聚簇始于热带太平洋东部，向西和向南逐渐扩展，随后时空聚簇在热带太平洋东部的覆盖范围开始收缩，最后消失于热带太平洋中部。
图4 4是DcSTCA方法的聚类结果，所选的时间阈值为2、属性相似性阈值为1.93及密度阈值为25，图中紫色轮廓多边形表示热带太平洋典型时空聚簇，淡灰色多边形表示其他时空聚簇。由图可知，在DcSTCA方法所识别的快照内，像元的专题属性值存在较大差异，换言之，快照内部的专题属性不一致，例如2015年9月、2015年12月与2016年2月等。此问题的原因在于DcSTCA方法无论是在空间维度还是在时间维度，对聚簇进行扩展时均以像元属性与聚簇内属性平均值的距离作为判断条件，并未充分考虑到海洋异常在时间维度上的变化程度可能不同于空间维度，有可能在时间维度上的变化程度大于在空间维度上的变化程度，例如2016年1月至2016年4月期间热带太平洋中部的降水正异常存在较快变化。在此情况下，虽然降低DcSTCA方法的属性相似性阈值可以提高快照对象内部的属性一致性，但有可能也会遗漏2016年2月或3月的降水异常像元。对于此问题，本文在时间维度和空间维度上分别采用不同的判断条件，在空间维度上聚类时考虑新像元与快照对象平均属性的距离，在时间维度上则考虑当前快照对象平均属性与相邻快照对象平均属性的距离，而不是整个时空聚簇的平均属性，以捕捉时空聚簇在不同时刻之间的快速变化。
仔细观察2015年11月和2016年1月DcSTCA的时空聚簇不难发现，当热带太平洋的降水异常变化向南扩张时，DcSTCA未能完全识别南部新扩张的区域，遗漏了部分边缘像元。此类像元遗漏问题的主要原因在于，DcSTCA方法要求核心像元在过去和未来的T时刻也具有相近的属性值，而且只有核心像元才能在其时空邻域内扩展时空聚簇，所以对于前后时刻空间范围变化较大的像元区域，DcSTCA无法识别突出的像元区域。针对此问题，本文在聚类时不考虑时空聚簇的时间跨度，只要2个不同时刻的快照对象存在一定程度的空间重叠且属性相近即可归为同一时空聚簇。这样既能捕捉长时间的持续动态变化，又能捕捉短时间内的突变"

1) Translation:

This paper applies the OSCAR method to the spatiotemporal clustering of sea surface precipitation anomalies between 2015 and 2016, with the method parameter θ set to 0.5, K to 7, and Kth to 1.41. Figure 4.2 shows the spatiotemporal clustering results during the El Niño event; the dark blue outlined polygons represent typical spatiotemporal clusters in the tropical Pacific, while the light gray outlined polygons represent other spatiotemporal clusters.

In May 2015, a spatiotemporal cluster with a precipitation anomaly significantly larger than the surrounding areas first appeared in the eastern tropical Pacific, elongated and extending westward to the central tropical Pacific. Between May and October 2015, the spatiotemporal cluster slowly expanded westward. From November 2015 to January 2016, the cluster stopped expanding westward and instead showed a southward expansion trend in the central tropical Pacific. During this time, the precipitation anomaly in the eastern tropical Pacific began to weaken and returned to normal levels by February 2016. Starting in February 2016, the area of the spatiotemporal cluster quickly decreased, and the SSPA values within the cluster also significantly decreased. Eventually, the spatiotemporal cluster ended in the central tropical Pacific in April 2016. In summary, the spatiotemporal cluster began in the eastern tropical Pacific, gradually expanded westward and southward, then the coverage area of the cluster in the eastern tropical Pacific began to shrink, and finally disappeared in the central tropical Pacific.

Figure 4.4 shows the clustering results of the DcSTCA method, with the selected time threshold set to 2, attribute similarity threshold set to 1.93, and density threshold set to 25. The purple outlined polygons represent the typical spatiotemporal clusters in the tropical Pacific, while the light gray polygons represent other spatiotemporal clusters. From the figure, it can be observed that there is a significant difference in the thematic attribute values of the pixels within the snapshots identified by the DcSTCA method. In other words, the thematic attributes within the snapshots are inconsistent, such as those in September 2015, December 2015, and February 2016. The cause of this issue is that the DcSTCA method uses the distance between pixel attributes and the average attributes within the cluster as judging criteria for cluster expansion in both spatial and temporal dimensions, without fully considering that the degree of change in the ocean anomaly in the temporal dimension may be different from that in the spatial dimension. For example, the precipitation anomaly in the central tropical Pacific between January and April 2016 changed more rapidly in the temporal dimension than in the spatial dimension. In this case, although reducing the attribute similarity threshold of the DcSTCA method can improve the attribute consistency within the snapshot objects, it may also miss precipitation anomaly pixels in February or March 2016. To address this issue, this paper adopts different judging criteria in the temporal and spatial dimensions. When clustering in the spatial dimension, the distance between the new pixel and the average attribute of the snapshot object is considered, while in the temporal dimension, the distance between the current snapshot object's average attribute and the average attribute of the adjacent snapshot object is considered, instead of the average attribute of the entire spatiotemporal cluster, to capture the rapid changes of the spatiotemporal cluster between different moments.

By carefully observing the spatiotemporal clusters of DcSTCA in November 2015 and January 2016, it is not difficult to find that when the precipitation anomaly changes in the tropical Pacific expand southward, DcSTCA fails to fully identify the newly expanded area in the south, omitting some boundary pixels. The main reason for this pixel omission issue is that the DcSTCA method requires the core pixels to have similar attribute values in the past and future T moments, and only the core pixels can expand the spatiotemporal cluster within their spatiotemporal neighborhood. Therefore, for pixel areas with larger spatial range changes at different moments, DcSTCA cannot identify the prominent pixel areas. To address this issue, this paper does not consider the time span of the spatiotemporal cluster during clustering; as long as two snapshot objects at different moments have a certain degree of spatial overlap and their attributes are similar, they can be classified as the same spatiotemporal cluster. This can capture both the long-lasting dynamic changes and the abrupt changes within a short period.

2) Rephrasing:

This study applies the OSCAR method to perform spatiotemporal clustering of sea surface precipitation anomalies from 2015 to 2016, utilizing parameters of θ=0.5, K=7, and Kth=1.41. Figure 4.2 illustrates the spatiotemporal clustering results during the El Niño event, with dark blue outlined polygons representing typical spatiotemporal clusters in the tropical Pacific and light gray outlined polygons signifying other spatiotemporal clusters.

In May 2015, an elongated spatiotemporal cluster with significantly larger positive precipitation anomalies than the surrounding areas first emerged in the eastern tropical Pacific, extending westward to the central tropical Pacific. The cluster continuously expanded westward between May and October 2015. From November 2015 to January 2016, the cluster ceased westward expansion, instead displaying a southward expansion trend in the central tropical Pacific. Concurrently, the positive precipitation anomaly in the eastern tropical Pacific began to weaken and had returned to normal levels by February 2016. From February 2016 onward, the area of the spatiotemporal cluster rapidly contracted, with SSPA values within the cluster also decreasing significantly. Ultimately, the spatiotemporal cluster ceased in the central tropical Pacific in April 2016. Overall, the cluster originated in the eastern tropical Pacific, expanded westward and southward, then began to contract in the eastern tropical Pacific before finally vanishing in the central tropical Pacific.

Figure 4.4 presents the clustering results of the DcSTCA method, with chosen time threshold =2, attribute similarity threshold =1.93, and density threshold =25. Purple outlined polygons represent typical spatiotemporal clusters in the tropical Pacific, while light gray polygons indicate other spatiotemporal clusters. The figure reveals substantial discrepancies in thematic attribute values for pixels within snapshots detected by the DcSTCA method, resulting in inconsistent thematic attributes within snapshots, as seen in September 2015, December 2015, and February 2016. This issue arises because the DcSTCA method relies on the distance between pixel attributes and average cluster attributes for cluster expansion in both spatial and temporal dimensions, without adequately accounting for potential differences in the rate of change in ocean anomalies across these dimensions. An example of this is the relatively rapid change in precipitation anomalies in the central tropical Pacific from January to April 2016. While lowering the attribute similarity threshold of the DcSTCA method can enhance attribute consistency within snapshot objects, this may also neglect precipitation anomaly pixels in February or March 2016.

To address this issue, the study adopts distinct judging criteria for temporal and spatial dimensions. During spatial dimension clustering, the distance between new pixels and the average attribute of snapshot objects is considered. In the temporal dimension, the distance between the current snapshot object's average attribute and the adjacent snapshot object's average attribute is assessed, rather than the entire spatiotemporal cluster's average attribute, capturing rapid changes in spatiotemporal clusters across different instances.

Close observation of the DcSTCA spatiotemporal clusters in November 2015 and January 2016 reveals that the method fails to fully recognize the newly expanded southern regions during southward expansions of precipitation anomaly changes in the tropical Pacific, omitting some boundary pixels. The primary cause for this pixel omission issue is the DcSTCA method's requirement for core pixels to possess similar attribute values within past and future T moments and that only core pixels can expand spatiotemporal clusters within their spatiotemporal neighborhoods. As a result, DcSTCA cannot detect prominent pixel areas when substantial spatial range changes occur between different moments. To address this issue, this study forgoes considering the spatiotemporal cluster's time span during clustering. Instead, two snapshot objects at different moments with a certain degree of spatial overlap and similar attributes can be classified as the same spatiotemporal cluster, capturing both long-lasting dynamic changes and abrupt changes within a short period.

"本文将采用双月多元ENSO指数（Multivariate ENSO Index，MEI）作为ENSO事件强弱的指标，对海表降水异常变化与ENSO的关系进行分析。MEI指数由海平面气压、海面温度、地表风的纬向和经向分量以及出射长波辐射5个指标计算得到（Wolter & Timlin，1993）。考虑到 ENSO的季节性及屏蔽季节内变化的影响，MEI指数对12个重叠的双月“季节”进行计算，例如12月至1月、1月至2月等等。McPhaden等（2006）曾根据MEI指数对ENSO事件进行定义：厄尔尼诺事件（El Niño）是指MEI指数至少持续5个月不小于0.5的时期，而拉尼娜事件（La Niña）是指MEI指数至少持续5个月不大于-0.5的时期。
GPM综合多卫星检索（The Integrated Multi-satellite Retrievals for GPM，IMERG）是Global Precipitation Measurement项目下的数据融合方法，在全球范围内对所有微波卫星降水数据、红外卫星降水数据以及其他降水数据进行相互校准、融合和插值。其中IMERG-Final Run是精度最高的科研数据系列，其时间覆盖范围是2000年6月至2021年9月。
获取IMERG-Final Run数据之后，将其重采样至1°×1°再计算降水异常变化。因为降水的月周期波动掩盖了ENSO事件引起的年周期波动，所以本文以月为单位利用Z-Score方法进行标准化距平，所得结果即为降水异常，计算公式如式2所示。

Step 1: Translate the paragraph into English

"In this study, the Bimonthly Multivariate ENSO Index (MEI) is used as an indicator of ENSO event strength to analyze the relationship between sea surface precipitation anomalies and ENSO. The MEI index is calculated from five factors, including sea level pressure, sea surface temperature, zonal and meridional components of surface wind, and outgoing longwave radiation (Wolter & Timlin, 1993). Considering the seasonality of ENSO and the shielding effect of seasonal variations, the MEI index is calculated for 12 overlapping bimonthly "seasons," such as December-January, January-February, and so on. McPhaden et al. (2006) defined ENSO events based on the MEI index: El Niño events are periods when the MEI index is at least 0.5 for five consecutive months, while La Niña events are periods when the MEI index is no greater than -0.5 for at least five consecutive months.

The Integrated Multi-satellite Retrievals for GPM (IMERG) is a data fusion method under the Global Precipitation Measurement project that calibrates, fuses, and interpolates data from all microwave satellite precipitation, infrared satellite precipitation, and other precipitation data globally. Among them, IMERG-Final Run is the most accurate research data series, which covers the time span from June 2000 to September 2021.

After obtaining the IMERG-Final Run data, it is resampled to 1°×1° to calculate precipitation anomalies. Since the monthly fluctuations in precipitation mask the annual fluctuations caused by ENSO events, this study uses the Z-Score method to standardize anomalies based on a monthly scale. The obtained results are the precipitation anomalies, and the calculation formula is shown in Equation 2."

Step 2: Polish the translation

"In this study, we employ the Bimonthly Multivariate ENSO Index (MEI) as an indicator for assessing the strength of ENSO events and analyzing the relationship between sea surface precipitation anomalies and ENSO. The MEI index is derived from five factors: sea level pressure, sea surface temperature, zonal and meridional components of surface wind, and outgoing longwave radiation (Wolter & Timlin, 1993). To account for ENSO's seasonality and minimize the impact of seasonal variations, the MEI index is calculated for 12 overlapping bimonthly "seasons," such as December-January, January-February, etc. Based on the MEI index, McPhaden et al. (2006) defined El Niño events as periods when the MEI index remains at or above 0.5 for five consecutive months, while La Niña events are periods with the MEI index at or below -0.5 for at least five consecutive months.

The Integrated Multi-satellite Retrievals for GPM (IMERG) is a data fusion method within the Global Precipitation Measurement project that globally calibrates, combines, and interpolates data from all microwave satellite precipitation, infrared satellite precipitation, and other precipitation sources. The IMERG-Final Run is the most accurate research data series within this project, and covers the timeframe from June 2000 to September 2021.

After securing the IMERG-Final Run data, we resample it to a 1°×1° grid and calculate precipitation anomalies. As monthly fluctuations in precipitation can obscure the annual fluctuations induced by ENSO events, we apply the Z-Score method to standardize anomalies on a monthly basis. The resulting values represent precipitation anomalies, with the corresponding calculation formula presented in Equation 2."

Below is a paragraph from an Chinese academic paper. Translate it step by step."本文将OSCAR方法应用于2015年至2016年之间海表降水异常变化的时空聚类，方法参数θ取0.5、K取7及Kth取1.41。图4 2是厄尔尼诺事件期间的时空聚类结果图，图中深蓝色轮廓多边形代表热带太平洋典型时空聚簇，淡灰色轮廓多边形代表其他时空聚簇。
在2015年5月，1个降水正异常强度显著大于周边区域的时空聚簇首次出现在热带太平洋东部，整体呈长条状，西至热带太平洋中部。在2015年5月至2015年10月之间，时空聚簇不断缓慢向西扩展。2015年11月至2016年1月，时空聚簇不再向西扩展，而是在热带太平洋中部呈现向南扩展的趋势，与此同时，热带太平洋东部的降水正异常开始减弱，到了2016年2月已经基本恢复正常水平。从2016年2月开始，时空聚簇的面积开始快速缩小，聚簇内的SSPA值也显著降低。最终时空聚簇在2016年4月结束于热带太平洋中部。总而言之，时空聚簇始于热带太平洋东部，向西和向南逐渐扩展，随后时空聚簇在热带太平洋东部的覆盖范围开始收缩，最后消失于热带太平洋中部。
图4 4是DcSTCA方法的聚类结果，所选的时间阈值为2、属性相似性阈值为1.93及密度阈值为25，图中紫色轮廓多边形表示热带太平洋典型时空聚簇，淡灰色多边形表示其他时空聚簇。由图可知，在DcSTCA方法所识别的快照内，像元的专题属性值存在较大差异，换言之，快照内部的专题属性不一致，例如2015年9月、2015年12月与2016年2月等。此问题的原因在于DcSTCA方法无论是在空间维度还是在时间维度，对聚簇进行扩展时均以像元属性与聚簇内属性平均值的距离作为判断条件，并未充分考虑到海洋异常在时间维度上的变化程度可能不同于空间维度，有可能在时间维度上的变化程度大于在空间维度上的变化程度，例如2016年1月至2016年4月期间热带太平洋中部的降水正异常存在较快变化。在此情况下，虽然降低DcSTCA方法的属性相似性阈值可以提高快照对象内部的属性一致性，但有可能也会遗漏2016年2月或3月的降水异常像元。对于此问题，本文在时间维度和空间维度上分别采用不同的判断条件，在空间维度上聚类时考虑新像元与快照对象平均属性的距离，在时间维度上则考虑当前快照对象平均属性与相邻快照对象平均属性的距离，而不是整个时空聚簇的平均属性，以捕捉时空聚簇在不同时刻之间的快速变化。
仔细观察2015年11月和2016年1月DcSTCA的时空聚簇不难发现，当热带太平洋的降水异常变化向南扩张时，DcSTCA未能完全识别南部新扩张的区域，遗漏了部分边缘像元。此类像元遗漏问题的主要原因在于，DcSTCA方法要求核心像元在过去和未来的T时刻也具有相近的属性值，而且只有核心像元才能在其时空邻域内扩展时空聚簇，所以对于前后时刻空间范围变化较大的像元区域，DcSTCA无法识别突出的像元区域。针对此问题，本文在聚类时不考虑时空聚簇的时间跨度，只要2个不同时刻的快照对象存在一定程度的空间重叠且属性相近即可归为同一时空聚簇。这样既能捕捉长时间的持续动态变化，又能捕捉短时间内的突变"

Step 1: Translate the paragraph into English

"This paper applies the OSCAR method to the spatiotemporal clustering of sea surface precipitation anomalies between 2015 and 2016, with the method parameter θ set to 0.5, K set to 7, and Kth set to 1.41. Figure 4.2 shows the spatiotemporal clustering results during El Niño events, with deep blue contours representing typical tropical Pacific spatiotemporal clusters and light gray contours representing other spatiotemporal clusters.
In May 2015, a spatiotemporal cluster first appeared in the eastern tropical Pacific with significantly positive precipitation anomalies greater than those in the surrounding area, extending westward to the central tropical Pacific in a long strip shape. Between May and October 2015, the spatiotemporal cluster slowly extended westward. From November 2015 to January 2016, the spatiotemporal cluster no longer extended westward but instead showed a trend of southward expansion in the central tropical Pacific. Meanwhile, the positive precipitation anomalies in the eastern tropical Pacific began to weaken, and by February 2016, they had returned to normal levels. Starting from February 2016, the area of the spatiotemporal cluster rapidly decreased, and the SSPA value in the cluster significantly dropped. The spatiotemporal cluster eventually ended in the central tropical Pacific in April 2016. In summary, the spatiotemporal cluster began in the eastern tropical Pacific, gradually expanded westward and southward, and then the coverage of the spatiotemporal cluster in the eastern tropical Pacific began to shrink, finally disappearing in the central tropical Pacific.

Figure 4.4 shows the clustering results of the DcSTCA method, with selected time thresholds of 2, attribute similarity thresholds of 1.93, and density thresholds of 25. The purple contours in the figure represent typical tropical Pacific spatiotemporal clusters, and the light gray contours represent other spatiotemporal clusters. It can be seen from the figure that there are significant differences in the thematic attribute values of pixels within the snapshots recognized by the DcSTCA method, indicating that the thematic attributes within the snapshot are inconsistent, as seen in September 2015, December 2015, February 2016, etc. This issue is due to the DcSTCA method considering both spatial and temporal dimensions as a judging condition for expanding clusters. This is based on the distance between pixel attributes and the average attributes in the cluster without fully considering that the degree of change in ocean anomalies in the temporal dimension may differ from that in the spatial dimension, as it may be more substantial in the temporal dimension than in the spatial dimension, such as the rapid change in positive precipitation anomalies in the central tropical Pacific between January and April 2016. In this case, although reducing the attribute similarity threshold of the DcSTCA method can improve the attribute consistency within the snapshot object, it may also omit precipitation anomaly pixels in February or March 2016. To address this issue, this paper uses different judging conditions in the temporal and spatial dimensions by considering the distance between the new pixel and the average attribute of the snapshot object in spatial clustering, while considering the distance between the average attribute of the current snapshot object and the adjacent snapshot object in the temporal dimension, rather than the average attribute of the entire spatiotemporal cluster, to capture the rapid changes between different time points in the spatiotemporal cluster.

By carefully observing the spatiotemporal clusters of DcSTCA in November 2015 and January 2016, it is not difficult to find that when the precipitation anomalies in the tropical Pacific change southward, DcSTCA fails to fully recognize the newly expanded area in the south, missing some boundary pixels. The main reason for this pixel omission problem is that DcSTCA requires core pixels to have similar attribute values in the past and future T-time periods, and only core pixels can expand the spatiotemporal cluster within its spatiotemporal neighborhood, so for pixel regions with large spatial range changes in previous and subsequent time periods, DcSTCA cannot recognize prominent pixel areas. To address this issue, this paper does not consider the temporal span of spatiotemporal clusters during clustering, and as long as two snapshot objects from different time points have a certain degree of spatial overlap and similar attributes, they can be classified as the same spatiotemporal cluster. This approach captures both long-term dynamic changes and short-term abrupt changes."

Step 2: Polish the translation

"In this study, we implement the OSCAR method for spatiotemporal clustering analysis of sea surface precipitation anomalies from 2015 to 2016, setting the method parameter θ to 0.5, K to 7, and Kth to 1.41. Figure 4.2 illustrates the spatiotemporal clustering results during the El Niño event, where deep blue outlined polygons represent typical tropical Pacific spatiotemporal clusters and light gray outlined polygons represent other clusters.
In May 2015, a spatiotemporal cluster, characterized by notably positive precipitation anomalies distinct from the surrounding regions, initially emerged in the eastern tropical Pacific, overall forming an elongated shape that extended westward to the central tropical Pacific. From May to October 2015, the spatiotemporal cluster persistently and gradually expanded westward. Between November 2015 and January 2016, the cluster ceased its westward expansion and instead exhibited a southward expansion trend in the central tropical Pacific. Concurrently, the eastern tropical Pacific's positive precipitation anomalies began to weaken, ultimately returning to normal levels by February 2016. Starting from February 2016, the spatiotemporal cluster's area notably diminished, accompanied by a significant decrease in its SSPA values. Eventually, the spatiotemporal cluster concluded in the central tropical Pacific in April 2016. Overall, the spatiotemporal cluster originated in the eastern tropical Pacific, gradually expanded both westward and southward, subsequently contracted its coverage in the eastern tropical Pacific before ultimately dissipating in the central tropical Pacific.

Figure 4.4 presents DcSTCA method clustering results, employing time threshold values of 2, attribute similarity thresholds of 1.93, and density thresholds of 25. In the figure, purple outlined polygons indicate typical tropical Pacific spatiotemporal clusters, while light gray polygons depict other clusters. As shown, there are substantial differences in the thematic attribute values of pixels within the snapshots identified by the DcSTCA method; in other words, thematic attributes within the snapshots are inconsistent, as evident in September 2015, December 2015, and February 2016, among others. This inconsistency stems from the DcSTCA method's expansion of clusters in both spatial and temporal dimensions, relying on the distance between pixel attributes and the average attributes within the cluster while neglecting the possibility that the degree of change in ocean anomalies in the temporal dimension may differ from the spatial dimension. For instance, the changes in the temporal dimension might be more significant than those in the spatial dimension, as seen in the rapid alterations in central tropical Pacific positive precipitation anomalies between January and April 2016. Despite reducing the DcSTCA method's attribute similarity threshold to enhance attribute consistency within snapshot objects, this approach may simultaneously overlook precipitation anomaly pixels in February or March 2016. To tackle this issue, we utilize different judging criteria in the temporal and spatial dimensions, considering the distance between a new pixel and snapshot object's average attribute during spatial clustering while assessing the distance between the current snapshot object's average attribute and adjacent snapshot object's average attribute in the temporal dimension - rather than the entire spatiotemporal cluster's average attribute - to capture rapid changes between different moments in the spatiotemporal cluster.

Upon close examination of the DcSTCA spatiotemporal clusters in November 2015 and January 2016, it becomes apparent that as tropical Pacific precipitation anomalies expand southward, DcSTCA fails to fully recognize the newly-expanded areas in the south, omitting some edge pixels. The principal cause of this pixel omission issue is that DcSTCA requires core pixels to exhibit similar attribute values in both past and future T-time periods and allows only core pixels to expand the spatiotemporal cluster within their spatiotemporal neighborhood. Therefore, DcSTCA cannot identify prominent pixel areas for pixel regions experiencing significant spatial range changes across previous and subsequent periods. In response to this issue, our study does not consider the temporal span of spatiotemporal clusters during clustering, classifying two snapshot objects from different time points with a certain degree of spatial overlap and similar attributes as the same spatiotemporal cluster. This approach effectively captures both persistent long-term dynamic changes and abrupt short-term changes."

I want you to act as a scientific English-Chinese translator. Your task contains 2 step: 1) translate accurately and academically the paragraphs only into English; 2) rephrase the English paragraphs to meet the academic style, improve the spelling, grammar, clarity, concision and overall readability. When necessary, rewrite the whole sentence. Translate the following paragraph and rephrase it step by step.
"本文的实验结果表明：厄尔尼诺事件期间热带太平洋中部和东部存在降水正异常时空聚簇；拉尼娜事件期间热带太平洋西部和中部存在降水负异常时空聚簇。相关文献显示，在厄尔尼诺事件期间（如2015年），温暖的海温异常导致热带太平洋中部降水增加；拉尼娜事件期间（如2010年），负降水异常与低海温异常同时出现于热带太平洋中西部（Zhu & Zhang，2023；Zhang & Busalacchi，2009；Huang，2015；Power，2013），这与本文的时空聚类结果基本一致。需要指出的是，已有文献是根据一定时间尺度下静态统计值得出来的结论，没有考虑降水异常的动态变化。"

Translation:
"The experimental results of this study indicate that during El Niño events, there are spatiotemporal clusters of positive precipitation anomalies in the central and eastern tropical Pacific; during La Niña events, there are spatiotemporal clusters of negative precipitation anomalies in the western and central tropical Pacific. Relevant literature reveals that during El Niño events (e.g., in 2015), warm sea surface temperature anomalies lead to increased precipitation in the central tropical Pacific; during La Niña events (e.g., in 2010), negative precipitation anomalies coexist with cold sea surface temperature anomalies in the central and western tropical Pacific (Zhu & Zhang, 2023; Zhang & Busalacchi, 2009; Huang, 2015; Power, 2013), which is consistent with the spatiotemporal clustering results of this study. It should be noted that existing literature conclusions are based on static statistical values at a certain time scale and do not consider the dynamic changes of precipitation anomalies."

Rephrased:
"The findings of this research demonstrate that during El Niño events, spatiotemporal clusters of positive precipitation anomalies are present in the central and eastern regions of the tropical Pacific Ocean. Conversely, during La Niña events, these clusters shift to negative precipitation anomalies in the western and central regions. Previous studies have shown that during El Niño events, such as the one in 2015, warm sea surface temperature anomalies contribute to increased precipitation in the central tropical Pacific. On the other hand, during La Niña events, such as the one in 2010, negative precipitation anomalies coincide with cold sea surface temperature anomalies in the central and western tropical Pacific (Zhu & Zhang, 2023; Zhang & Busalacchi, 2009; Huang, 2015; Power, 2013). These findings align with our study's spatiotemporal clustering results. However, it is worth noting that existing literature has primarily focused on static statistical values within particular time scales, neglecting the dynamic fluctuations of precipitation anomalies."

Step 1: Translate into English:
"The experimental results in this paper show that during El Niño events, there are positive spatiotemporal clusters of precipitation anomalies in the central and eastern tropical Pacific Ocean; during La Niña events, there are negative spatiotemporal clusters of precipitation anomalies in the western and central tropical Pacific Ocean. The literature shows that during El Niño events (such as 2015), warm sea temperature anomalies lead to increased precipitation in the central tropical Pacific Ocean; during La Niña events (such as 2010), negative precipitation anomalies and low sea temperature anomalies occur simultaneously in the central and western tropical Pacific Ocean (Zhu & Zhang, 2023; Zhang & Busalacchi, 2009; Huang, 2015; Power, 2013), which is basically consistent with the spatiotemporal results of this paper. It should be noted that the existing literature is based on conclusions derived from static statistical values at a certain time scale and does not consider the dynamic changes of precipitation anomalies."

Step 2: Rephrase in academic style and improve clarity:
"The findings of this study indicate that during El Niño events, positive spatiotemporal clusters of precipitation anomalies are present in the central and eastern regions of the tropical Pacific Ocean, while during La Niña events, negative spatiotemporal clusters of precipitation anomalies occur in the western and central regions of the tropical Pacific Ocean. Previous research has demonstrated that during El Niño events (e.g., 2015), warm sea temperature anomalies result in increased precipitation in the central tropical Pacific Ocean. Conversely, during La Niña events (e.g., 2010), negative precipitation anomalies coexist with low sea temperature anomalies in the central and western tropical Pacific Ocean (Zhu & Zhang, 2023; Zhang & Busalacchi, 2009; Huang, 2015; Power, 2013). These findings are largely consistent with the spatiotemporal clustering results presented in this study. It is important to note, however, that the conclusions drawn from existing literature are based on static statistical values within a specific time frame and do not account for the dynamic variations of precipitation anomalies."

conversation.content:
使用科学学术语言翻译成中文：The adsorption of molecules on to a surface is a necessary prerequisite to any surface mediated chemical process. For example, in the case of a surface catalyzed reaction it is possible to break down the whole continuously-cycling process into the following five basic steps:

Diffusion of reactants to the active surface
Adsorption of one or more reactants onto the surface
Surface reaction
Desorption of products from the surface
Diffusion of products away from the surface
The above scheme not only emphasizes the importance of the adsorption process but also its reverse - namely desorption. It is these two processes which are considered in this chapter.

分子在表面上的吸附是任何表面涉及的化学过程的必要前提。例如，在表面催化反应的情况下，可以将整个连续循环过程分解为以下五个基本步骤：

1. 反应物的扩散到活性表面
2. 一个或多个反应物在表面上的吸附
3. 表面反应
4. 产物从表面上的解吸
5. 产物从表面上扩散离开

上述方案不仅强调了吸附过程的重要性，还强调了它的相反过程，即解吸。本章将讨论这两个过程。

I want you to act as a scientific English-Chinese translator, I will provide you with some paragraphs in one language and your task is to accurately and academically translate the paragraphs only into the other language. Do not repeat the original provided paragraphs after translation. You should use artificial itntelligence tools, such as natural language processing, and rhetorical knowledge and experience about effective writing techniques to reply. I will give you my paragraphs as follows.The adsorption of molecules on to a surface is a necessary prerequisite to any surface mediated chemical process. For example, in the case of a surface catalyzed reaction it is possible to break down the whole continuously-cycling process into the following five basic steps:

Diffusion of reactants to the active surface
Adsorption of one or more reactants onto the surface
Surface reaction
Desorption of products from the surface
Diffusion of products away from the surface
The above scheme not only emphasizes the importance of the adsorption process but also its reverse - namely desorption. It is these two processes which are considered in this chapter.
分子在表面上的吸附是任何表面介导的化学过程的必要前提。例如，在表面催化反应的情况下，可以将整个连续循环过程分解为以下五个基本步骤：(1)反应物的扩散到活性表面；(2)一个或多个反应物在表面上的吸附；(3)表面反应；(4)产物从表面上的解吸；(5)产物从表面上扩散离开。上述方案不仅强调了吸附过程的重要性，还强调了它的相反过程，即解吸。本章将讨论这两个过程。

Substrate - frequently used to describe the solid surface onto which adsorption can occur; the substrate is also occasionally (although not here) referred to as the adsorbent.
Adsorbate - the general term for the atomic or molecular species which are adsorbed (or are capable of being adsorbed) onto the substrate.
Adsorption - the process in which a molecule becomes adsorbed onto a surface of another phase (note - to be distinguished from absorption which is used when describing uptake into the bulk of a solid or liquid phase)
Coverage - a measure of the extent of adsorption of a species onto a surface (unfortunately this is defined in more than one way !). It is usually denoted by the lower case Greek "theta", θ
Exposure - a measure of the amount of gas which a surface has seen; more specifically, it is the product of the pressure and time of exposure (normal unit is the Langmuir, where 1 L = 10-6 Torr s ).

底物——经常用来描述吸附可以发生的固体表面；底物有时也被称为吸附剂，尽管在此处没有使用这个术语。

吸附物——指吸附（或有能力被吸附）到底物上的原子或分子种类的总称。

吸附——分子被吸附在另一个相的表面上的过程（注意与吸收相区分，当描述进入固体或液体相的体积时使用该术语）。

覆盖度——吸附物质吸附在表面上的程度的一种度量方式（不幸的是，有不止一种定义！）。通常用希腊字母θ表示。

暴露度——衡量固体表面暴露给气体的量的度量方式；更具体地，它是压力和暴露时间的乘积（常用单位是Langmuir，其中1L=10-6 Torr s）。

There are two principal modes of adsorption of molecules on surfaces: Physical Adsorption (physisorption ) and Chemical Adsorption (chemisorption). The basis of distinction is the nature of the bonding between the molecule and the surface with:

Physical Adsorption: the only bonding is by weak Van der Waals - type forces. There is no significant redistribution of electron density in either the molecule or at the substrate surface.
Chemisorption: a chemical bond, involving substantial rearrangement of electron density, is formed between the adsorbate and substrate. The nature of this bond may lie anywhere between the extremes of virtually complete ionic or complete covalent character.

分子在表面上的吸附有两种主要方式：物理吸附（physisorption）和化学吸附（chemisorption）。二者的主要区别是分子与表面之间的键合性质：

物理吸附：分子与表面之间的键合仅由弱的范德华力产生。在分子或底物表面，没有任何显著的电子密度重新分布。

化学吸附：在吸附物质和表面之间形成一种化学键，涉及到电子密度的实质性重新排列。这种化学键的性质可能处于几乎完全离子型或完全共价型之间的任何极端。

ypical Characteristics of Adsorption Processes
Chemisorption	Physisorption
Material Specificity
(variation between substrates of different chemical composition)	Substantial variation between materials	Slight dependence upon substrate composition
Crystallographic Specificity
(variation between different surface planes of the same crystal)	Marked variation between crystal planes	Virtually independent of surface atomic geometry
Temperature Range
(over which adsorption occurs)	Virtually unlimited
(but a given molecule may effectively adsorb only over a small range)	Near or below the condensation point of the gas
(e.g. Xe < 100 K, CO2 < 200 K)
Adsorption Enthalpy	Wide range (related to the chemical bond strength) - typically 40 - 800 kJ mol-1	Related to factors like molecular mass and polarity - typically 5-40 kJ mol-1
(similar to heat of liquefaction)
Nature of Adsorption	Often dissociative
May be irreversible	Non-dissociative
Reversible
Saturation Uptake	Limited to one monolayer	Multilayer uptake possible
Kinetics of Adsorption	Very variable - often an activated process	Fast - since it is a non-activated process

吸附过程的典型特征
化学吸附	            物理吸附
材料特异性
（不同化学成分的底物之间的差异）材料之间存在明显变化，微弱取决于底物的成分
晶体学特异性
（在相同晶体的不同表面之间的变化）晶体表面平面之间存在显著变化，几乎不依赖于表面原子几何形状
吸附的温度范围
（吸附发生的温度范围）几乎没有限制（但给定分子可能只在较小的范围内有效地吸附）靠近或低于气体的凝结点（例如，Xe＜100K，CO2＜200K）
吸附焓
广泛的范围（与化学键强度相关）-通常在40-800 kJ / mol-1之间
相关因素如分子质量和极性-通常在5-40 kJ / mol-1之间（类似于液化热）
吸附性质                                                                             通常是解离性的
可能是不可逆的                                                               非解离性的
可逆的
饱和吸附量
仅限于一层分子                                                                   可以多层吸收
吸附动力学
非常可变-经常是一个激活的过程                                                  快-因为它是一个非激活的过程

conversation.content:
下面是我写的科技论文，请帮我润色一下并修改其中的语法错误，标注出你修改的地方：In this paper, we propose a dual-color double-pulse ablation to improve the ablation rate of copper with the two pulses operating at wavelengths of 515 nm and 1030 nm. As a transition metal, the interband transmission of electrons from d-band above Fermi level can be easily induced by 515 nm with single photon energy of 2.4 eV. In comparison, the two-photon absorption is needed for 1030 nm because the gap between d-band and Fermi level of copper is around 2.15 eV at room temperature. The interband absorption induced by 515 nm can excite more electrons from d-band above Fermi level. These electrons contribute to the electron–electron scattering frequency and alter the optical properties. Moreover, the surface reflectivity of copper for 515 nm is about 59%, much lower than that of 1030 nm which is about 97% according to Winter et al.21. With lower surface reflectivity, more energy is absorbed by the material instead of reflected in the air. Therefore, we adopt 515 nm as the first pulse instead of 1030 nm in the double pulse ablation to increase the light absorption by the material. Moreover, the inter-pulse delay is chosen to be within the electron–phonon coupling time range to prevent suppression.
EXPERIMENT
The experimental setup details were described elsewhere22. Briefly, a laser pulse with wavelength of 1030 nm and a pulse duration of about 200 fs generated by a commercial Light Conversion laser system is split into two parts through a polarization beam splitter (PBS). One passes through a BBO (β-BaB2O4) crystal to generate 515 nm wavelength through a nonlinear process. While the other one passes through a delay line to adjust the delay between two paths by optical path difference. Two beams are focused on the surface of copper film by a focusing lens with a focal length of 150 mm. The spot size of 515 nm is shrunk to half by a telescope system to keep the same focused spot size as 1030 nm on the focusing surface. The fluence of 1030 nm is set to be 1.0 J/cm2, which is around our experiment's maximum ablation efficiency. Meanwhile, the fluence of 515 nm varied from 0.1 and 0.5 to 1.0 J/cm2. The delay between two pulses tdelay = t1030 - t515 is from -5 ~ 30 ps, where t515 and t1030 are the arriving time on the ablated surface of the 515 nm and 1030 nm, respectively. Grooves are machined on the X-Y motion stage at a scanning speed of 50 mm/s. The ablation depth of grooves is measured by using commercial confocal microscopy (ZEISS-LSM-800).
MODELING AND SIMULATION
The optical properties change of reflectivity (R) and absorption coefficient ( ) for copper induced by ultrashort-pulse lasers may alter the energy deposition in the target. A critical point model with three Lorentzian terms for interband transition of copper can be used to evaluate dielectric permittivity which was proposed by Ren et al.23

In this paper, we propose a dual-color, double-pulse ablation to improve the ablation rate of copper with two pulses operating at wavelengths of 515 nm and 1030 nm. As a transition metal, the interband transmission of electrons from the d-band above the Fermi level can be easily induced by 515 nm with a single photon energy of 2.4 eV. In comparison, two-photon absorption is needed for 1030 nm, as the gap between the d-band and Fermi level of copper is around 2.15 eV at room temperature. The interband absorption induced by 515 nm can excite more electrons from the d-band above the Fermi level. These electrons contribute to the electron–electron scattering frequency and alter the optical properties. Moreover, the surface reflectivity of copper for 515 nm is about 59%, much lower than that of 1030 nm, which is about 97%, according to Winter et al.21. With lower surface reflectivity, more energy is absorbed by the material instead of being reflected into the air. Therefore, we adopt 515 nm as the first pulse instead of 1030 nm in the double-pulse ablation to increase the light absorption by the material. Furthermore, the inter-pulse delay is chosen to be within the electron–phonon coupling time range to prevent suppression.

EXPERIMENT

The experimental setup details were described elsewhere22. Briefly, a laser pulse with a wavelength of 1030 nm and a pulse duration of about 200 fs is generated by a commercial Light Conversion laser system and split into two parts through a polarization beam splitter (PBS). One part passes through a BBO (β-BaB2O4) crystal to generate a 515 nm wavelength through a nonlinear process, while the other part passes through a delay line to adjust the delay between the two paths by an optical path difference. The two beams are focused on the surface of the copper film by a focusing lens with a focal length of 150 mm. The spot size of 515 nm is shrunk to half by a telescope system to maintain the same focused spot size as 1030 nm on the focusing surface. The fluence of 1030 nm is set to be 1.0 J/cm2, which is around our experiment's maximum ablation efficiency. Meanwhile, the fluence of 515 nm varies from 0.1 to 1.0 J/cm2. The delay between the two pulses, tdelay = t1030 - t515, ranges from -5 ~ 30 ps, where t515 and t1030 are the arrival times on the ablated surface of the 515 nm and 1030 nm pulses, respectively. Grooves are machined on the X-Y motion stage at a scanning speed of 50 mm/s. The ablation depth of the grooves is measured using commercial confocal microscopy (ZEISS-LSM-800).

MODELING AND SIMULATION

The optical property changes of reflectivity (R) and absorption coefficient (α) for copper induced by ultrashort-pulse lasers may alter the energy deposition in the target. A critical point model with three Lorentzian terms for the interband transition of copper can be used to evaluate dielectric permittivity, as proposed by Ren et al.23.

Sincerely,

Organ development analysis is very important for the assessment of individual growth health. In this paper, we presented a method for quantitative characterization of multiple organs of zebrafish during their growth using non-invasive Mueller matrix optical coherence tomography (Mueller matrix OCT) combined with deep learning. Firstly, Mueller matrix OCT was employed to obtain 3D images during the development of zebrafish. The deep learning U-net network was applied to segment the body, eyes, spine, yolk sac and swim bladder of zebrafish. Then the volume of each organ of zebrafish were calculated after segmentation. Finally, the development and proportion trend of zebrafish embryos and organs from 1 to 19 days were quantitatively analyzed. Various quantitative results demonstrated that the volume development of fish body and various organs showed a steady growth trend. Small organs such as spine and swim bladder were also successfully quantified during the growth process. The results indicate that Muller matrix OCT combined with deep learning can effectively quantify the development of various organs during the development from zebrafish embryos. This will provide a more intuitive and effective monitoring method for clinical medicine and developmental biology.

Title: Quantitative Characterization of Zebrafish Organ Development using Mueller Matrix Optical Coherence Tomography and Deep Learning

Abstract:

Organ development analysis plays a crucial role in assessing an individual's growth health. In this study, we present a non-invasive method for the quantitative characterization of multiple zebrafish organs during their growth, utilizing Mueller matrix optical coherence tomography (Mueller matrix OCT) in conjunction with deep learning. Firstly, Mueller matrix OCT was employed to acquire 3D images of zebrafish during development. Subsequently, a deep learning-based U-Net network was applied to segment various anatomical structures, including the body, eyes, spine, yolk sac, and swim bladder of the zebrafish. Following segmentation, the volume of each organ was calculated. Finally, we quantitatively analyzed the development and proportional trends of zebrafish embryos and organs from day 1 to day 19. The obtained quantitative results revealed that the volume development of the fish body and individual organs exhibited a consistent growth pattern. Additionally, smaller organs, such as the spine and swim bladder, were successfully quantified during the growth process. Our findings demonstrate that the combination of Mueller matrix OCT and deep learning effectively quantifies the development of various organs throughout zebrafish embryonic development. This approach offers a more intuitive and efficient monitoring method for clinical medicine and developmental biology studies.
